column3: str
Hayase is scrutinizing the area.
Patrol the area for suspicious activity.
Report to Hayase.
You there! Show me your─ah...never mind. You appear strong but do not look vicious enough to commit such an atrocious crime.
<sigh> You see, the other day we found the dead body of one of our comrades.
He died of a knife wound to the back and through the chest. Poor bastard. No one turns their back on an enemy, so more likely than not, he was killed by a friend.
We need to prevent any further casualties, and I ask that you assist us. Please patrol the more secluded areas of our island and save anyone who looks like they might be in danger.
Please patrol the island for any suspicious activity and save anyone who appears to be in harm's way.
Hayase requested that you survey the island for suspicious activity? I can't say I have noticed anything out of the ordinary, but I will definitely keep my eyes peeled. Thanks for the warning.
I have not noticed anything unusual but I will keep my eyes and ears peeled.
You are looking for a murderer? Ah, well, I am looking for clams. Good for you and sadly for me, I have spotted neither.
Nope, no murderers...<sigh>...and most definitely no clams around here.
Nothing suspicious here, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>madam<Else/>sir</If>! Now, if there is nothing else, I really must return to training!
My apologies, but you are breaking my concentration. If there is nothing else of import, please allow me to carry on with my training.

Thank the kami you arrived when you did. You saved my life. <sigh> I was tricked into coming here by a man who claimed to be a fisherman. He said he had a job opportunity for me, but I should have known better.
I must return and have my wounds looked at. You best leave this place, too. There might be others lurking about in the shadows.
Ah, you have returned. Thank you for surveying the island and saving one of our comrades from certain death.
We did a bit of investigating and discovered that the alleged fisherman's victims have one thing in common.

The two of them once stopped a ship full of ronin seeking passage through the Ruby Sea. Upon demanding that they pay the Ruby Tithe, the nomad samurai drew their swords and all hells broke loose. A great deal of blood was shed that day.
By the sound of it, these men had come to avenge the deaths of their compatriots. It doesn't surprise me. Most ronin are no better than your average criminal.
Sadly, this incident cost us a good man. Thanks to you, however, we were able to prevent any more casualties. Please accept this gift as a token of our appreciation.
